text: hey it's angel happy April Fool's so
today is April 1st and I thought I would
do an April Fool's video because the
last time I pulled an April Fool's joke
well I got grounded I'll tell you what I
did specifically but I can tell you that
it involves saran wrap and the toilet so
anyways this video is dedicated to all
the bubble tea lovers out there somebody
who had asked me to please please please
make boba from scratch so basically you
wanted to see me while my own tapioca at
home so I thought sure why not
I'll do it for April Fool's yeah while
I'm at it I will make some giant boba
pearls so here we go for this recipe
we'll need a few simple ingredients
we'll need about a cup of tapioca starch
some brown sugar if you plan on eating
this I've got two tablespoons of brown
sugar and a food coloring pack so you
don't need all the colors you just need
read me and yo first we'll need 1/3 cup
of hot water add your brown sugar and
stir until the sugar has completely
dissolved
then add your food coloring I'm using 28
drops of red 16 drops of yellow and
eight drops of green which should give
you a nice brown color stir the colors
while before mixing with one cup of
tapioca starch now we're starting with 1
cup of tapioca starch but depending on
how humid it is you'll probably need to
add a bit more starch add more starch a
bit at a time until the mixture is a
thicker texture that looks like this
next begin to roll your pearls I'm going
to make a few small ones first break off
a small piece of the tapioca dough and
press and mold into a ball shape with
your fingers now it won't feel like
regular dough but don't worry that's the
way it's supposed to be once you're done
making a few small ones let's make the
giant boba get a handful of the dough
and again press and mold into a hand
size ball shape you should be able to
make about three giant boba pearls once
you're done wash your hands and bring a
pot of water to a rolling boil put the
boba into water and boil on medium high
for 25 to 35 minutes
once you're done boiling turn off the
heat and cover with the lid let the pots
it covered for another 25 minutes before
straining and rinsing the boba under
cold water to stop the cooking process
and make it chewy when you're done you
can place the boba in a dish of simple
syrup to sweeten them and so they don't
stick together
so this is how you can make a giant ball
of boba at home pretty neat huh I hope
you guys enjoyed this video and I will
see you guys next time Cheers
I am NOT going to eat that
it looks so slimy too weird
I wonder if it sticks on the window whoa
you
